item.title: Antisocial behavior criminal activity On 03/09/24 at 23:35pm victims live at 3 Lavington Cl, London E9 5HF.There was a arson attack on a Irish travellers vehicle parked in lavington close car park bay L57.Two Irish white males early 20s set fire to this blue ford GJ20 KLD vehicle with a petrol can pouring flammable liquid down the side of the driver's side door then igniting car inflames.Two Irish males fled the scene running off after arson attack which has been planned and pre-meditated for a fraudulent insurance claim. Homerton fire brigade department attended scene and put fire out on vehicle. Firefighter stated the fire had been started,caused deliberately. Firefighter reported incident to metropolitan police to attend for investigation.Territorial police group unit 334 meetwagon attended levington close where they found a group of Irish males early 20s hanging around in a uninsured vehicle untaxed no MOT sees the vehicle and arrested the driver. This whole event caused distress and disturbance to surrounding neighbours. Police officers did not contain the Irish group who were causing loud noise and nuisance as they were present. Public order offences wise police are around not doing their duty. Police were knocking on resident Door early hours in the morning asking if they've seen anything. Police looking for possible evidence and CCTV.Residents are seriously concerned with incident of premeditated fire arson attack on a car has caused fear & distress to surrounding neighbours. Residents are in fear if these two Irish males are capable of doing this imagine it was somebody's home or the car fire escalated to burning someone's home. This needs to be taken seriously an investigated. Hackney Council and authority need to do their duty to safeguard Residence and members of public this is not on. The mayor of Hackney. The metropolitan police commissioner. Get your act together and serve the community., 5th September
item.description:

item.title: Tree needs pruning, 5th September
item.description:
The tree at no 5 Parkhurst Road is overhanging the pavement so much only part of pavement can be accessed without branches hitting you in the face. Needs to be trimmed back.

item.title: Overgrown trees/hedges fruit on pavements not being swept, 5th September
item.description:
For around 3 weeks Stanway Street’s pavement at the front of Sara Lane Court has not been swept. There is currently overgrown hedges or trees coming from the art studio at the basement of Sara Lane Court with a lot of fruit fallen to the pavement from it.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Arden Estate, Hackney, London

item.title: Collapsed man hole, 5th September
item.description:

item.title: Tree Obscuring Street Light, 4th September
item.description:
On Chipperfield Road at the junction with Cotmandene Crescent, St Paul’s Cray, Orpington: A street tree is obscuring a street light - asset ID number: 16C40. This is leaving the junction unlit and dark at night for pedestrians crossing the road and vehicles turning left or right. Please could the tree be cut back. 16C40
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 149, Chipperfield Road, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road work taking over the scheduled time, 4th September
item.description:
This road work suppose to finish at 30/08/2025. but it is 4/9/2025 and the work still not half way yet, can not see people working there, road has been closed for long time, traffic is very bad especially during the peak time, area around this has huge impact of this. when can this be finished. NO ONE IS WORKING ON SITE!!!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Centre Common Road, Chislehurst, London
